Name:
Enns
Enns
Drava
Namesake:
Enns River
Enns River
Drava River
Builder: Schiffswerft Linz / Stabilimento Tecnico Triestino Linz
Fate:
Transferred to the Hungarian People's Republic
Assigned to the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes (KSCS)
Sunk by Luftwaffe dive bombers on 12 April 1941
Notes: Sister ship Inn was ceded to Romania and renamed Besarabia
Armament:
2 × 120 mm (4.7 in) L/45 guns (1 × 2)
3 × 120 mm (4.7 in) L/10 howitzers (3 × 1)
2 × 66 mm (2.6 in) L/50 anti-aircraft guns (2 × 1)
6 × 8 mm (0.31 in) machine guns
Armour:
Belt and bulkheads: 40 mm (1.6 in)
Deck: 25 mm (0.98 in)
Conning tower and gun turrets: 50 mm (2.0 in)
